conclusion: Shadows are formed when an object blocks light. The shape and size of the shadow depend on the shape of the object and the position of the light source.
The size of the shadow is influenced by the distance between the object and the light source. When the light source is closer, the shadow is larger; when it is farther, the shadow is smaller.
The light source is currently positioned above the objects, casting shadows on the ground.
